Class EnhancedScroller

The EnhancedScroller allows you to easily set up a dynamic scroller that will recycle views for you. This means that using only a handful of views, you can display thousands of rows. This will save memory and processing power in your application.

Inheritance
System.Object
EnhancedScroller
Implements
IBeginDragHandler
IEndDragHandler
Namespace: EnhancedUI.EnhancedScroller

CellViewWillRecycleDelegate

loopWhileDragging

Whether the scroller should process loop jumping while being dragged. Note: if this is turned off while using a small list size, you may see elements missing while dragging near the edges of the list. Turning this value off can sometimes help with Unity adding a lot of velocity while dragging near the end of a list that loops. If this value is turned off, you can mitigate the large inertial velocity by setting the maxVelocity value to a non-zero amount (see maxVelocity).

Declaration
public bool loopWhileDragging
Field Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

maxVelocity

The maximum speed the scroller can go. This can be useful to eliminate aggressive scrolling by the user. It can also be used to mitigate the large inertial velocity that Unity adds in the ScrollRect when dragging and looping near the edge of the list (See loopWhileDragging).

Declaration
public float maxVelocity
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

snapCellCenterOffset

Once the cell has been snapped to the scroller location, this value will determine how the cell is centered on that scroller location. Typically, the offset is in the range 0..1, with 0 being the top / left of the cell and 1 being the bottom / right.

Declaration
public float snapCellCenterOffset
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

snapJumpToOffset

The snap location to move the cell to. When the snap occurs, this location in the scroller will be where the snapped cell is moved to. Typically, the offset is in the range 0..1, with 0 being the top / left of the scroller and 1 being the bottom / right. In most situations the watch offset and the jump offset will be the same, they are just separated in case you need that added functionality.

Declaration
public float snapJumpToOffset
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

snapping

Whether snapping is turned on

Declaration
public bool snapping
Field Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

snapTweenTime

The time it takes to interpolate between the current scroll position and the snap location. If you want to go immediately to the snap location you can either set the snapTweenType to immediate or set the snapTweenTime to zero.

Declaration
public float snapTweenTime
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

snapTweenType

What function to use when interpolating between the current scroll position and the snap location. This is also known as easing. If you want to go immediately to the snap location you can either set the snapTweenType to immediate or set the snapTweenTime to zero.

Declaration
public EnhancedScroller.TweenType snapTweenType
Field Value
Type Description
EnhancedScroller.TweenType

snapUseCellSpacing

Declaration
public bool snapUseCellSpacing

Type Description
System.Boolean

snapVelocityThreshold

This is the speed that will initiate the snap. When the scroller slows down to this speed it will snap to the location specified.

Declaration
public float snapVelocityThreshold
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

snapWatchOffset

The snap offset to watch for. When the snap occurs, this location in the scroller will be how which cell to snap to is determined. Typically, the offset is in the range 0..1, with 0 being the top / left of the scroller and 1 being the bottom / right. In most situations the watch offset and the jump offset will be the same, they are just separated in case you need that added functionality.

Declaration
public float snapWatchOffset
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

snapWhileDragging

While true keeps snapping while the scroller is dragged. While false, this will disable snapping until the dragging stops.

Declaration
public bool snapWhileDragging

Loop

Whether the scroller should loop the resulting cell views. Looping creates three sets of internal size data, attempting to keep the scroller in the middle set. If the scroller goes outside of this set, it will jump back into the middle set, giving the illusion of an infinite set of data.

Declaration
public bool Loop { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

The index of the last cell visible

ClearActive()

Removes all the active cell views. This should only be used if you want to get rid of cells because of settings set by Unity that cannot be changed at runtime. This will call garbage collection.

Declaration
public void ClearActive()

ClearAll()

Removes all cells, both active and recycled from the scroller. This will call garbage collection.

Declaration
public void ClearAll()

ClearRecycled()

Removes all the recycled cell views. This should only be used after you load in a completely different set of cell views that will not use the recycled views. This will call garbage collection.

Declaration
public void ClearRecycled()

GetCellViewAtDataIndex(Int32)

Get a cell view for a particular data index. If the cell view is not currently in the visible range, then this method will return null. Note: this is against MVC principles and will couple your controller to the view more than this paradigm would suggest. Generally speaking, the view can have knowledge about the controller, but the controller should not know anything about the view. Use this method sparingly if you are trying to adhere to strict MVC design.

Declaration
public EnhancedScrollerCellView GetCellViewAtDataIndex(int dataIndex)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 dataIndex

The data index of the cell view to return
Returns
Type Description
EnhancedScrollerCellView

JumpToDataIndex(Int32, Single, Single, Boolean, EnhancedScroller.TweenType, Single, Action, EnhancedScroller.LoopJumpDirectionEnum)

Jump to a position in the scroller based on a dataIndex. This overload allows you to specify a specific offset within a cell as well.

Declaration
public void JumpToDataIndex(int dataIndex, float scrollerOffset = 0F, float cellOffset = 0F, bool useSpacing = true, EnhancedScroller.TweenType tweenType = EnhancedScroller.TweenType.immediate, float tweenTime = 0F, Action jumpComplete = null, EnhancedScroller.LoopJumpDirectionEnum loopJumpDirection = EnhancedScroller.LoopJumpDirectionEnum.Closest)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Int32 dataIndex

he data index to jump to
System.Single scrollerOffset

The offset from the start (top / left) of the scroller in the range 0..1. Outside this range will jump to the location before or after the scroller's viewable area
System.Single cellOffset

The offset from the start (top / left) of the cell in the range 0..1
System.Boolean useSpacing

Whether to calculate in the spacing of the scroller in the jump
EnhancedScroller.TweenType tweenType

What easing to use for the jump
System.Single tweenTime

How long to interpolate to the jump point
System.Action jumpComplete

This delegate is fired when the jump completes
EnhancedScroller.LoopJumpDirectionEnum loopJumpDirection

OnBeginDrag(PointerEventData)

This event is fired when the user begins dragging on the scroller. We can disable looping or snapping while dragging if desired.

The event data for the drag
Declaration
public void OnBeginDrag(PointerEventData data)
Parameters
Type Name Description
PointerEventData data

OnEndDrag(PointerEventData)

This event is fired when the user ends dragging on the scroller. We can re-enable looping or snapping while dragging if desired.

The event data for the drag
Declaration
public void OnEndDrag(PointerEventData data)
Parameters
Type Name Description
PointerEventData data

RefreshActiveCellViews()

This calls the RefreshCellView method on each active cell. If you override the RefreshCellView method in your cells then you can update the UI without having to reload the data. Note: this will not change the cell sizes, you will need to call ReloadData for that to work.

Declaration
public void RefreshActiveCellViews()

ReloadData(Single)

This resets the internal size list and refreshes the cell views

Declaration
public void ReloadData(float scrollPositionFactor = 0F)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Single scrollPositionFactor

The percentage of the scroller to start at between 0 and 1, 0 being the start of the scroller

Snap()

Snaps the scroller on command. This is called internally when snapping is set to true and the velocity has dropped below the threshold. You can use this to manually snap whenever you like.

Declaration
public void Snap()

ToggleLoop()

Turn looping on or off. This is just a helper function so you don't have to keep track of the state of the looping in your own scripts.

Declaration
public void ToggleLoop()
